channel.title: GPS on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in GPS on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] Let's make a cycle computer with Raspberry Pi Zero (W, WH)
item.description: github repository is here https://github.com/hishizuka/pizero_bikecomputer (2020/4/30) The article structure was reviewed and the “latest update” was added to the original article “[The story that when I made a cycle computer with Gachi, I was able to make it fairly]” (https://qiita .com/hishi/items/8f77fd4655027fac7c7d)‚Äù. It will be the 22nd day of Road Bike Advent Calendar 2019. This is a technically unusual post, but I would appreciate your favor. The author has been working on making a cycle computer from scratch for several years.

item.title: [Python] Handling GPS with Raspberry Pi 3 Python
item.description: This is a memo of GPS module in Raspberry Pi 3 Python. The OS version of Raspberry Pi 3 is Raspbian GNU/Linux 8.0 (jessie) Raspbian GNU/Linux 9.4 (stretch) (Corrected on October 5, 2018) is. GPS module For the GPS module, I used Akizuki Denshi’s “[GPS receiver kit 1PPS output with “Michibiki” compatible]” (http://akizukidenshi.com/catalog/g/gK-09991/)". This GPS module sends out the received GPS data serially. There are two methods for serial communication with Raspberry Pi3: using a USB port and using a GPIO pin.
